instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to /app/frontend/src/index.css immediately.
2. CONFIGURE TAILWIND: Update /app/frontend/tailwind.config.js to use the 'Obsidian Tactical' color palette defined above. Ensure 'darkMode' is set to 'class'.
3. FORCE DARK MODE: In /app/frontend/src/index.js or App.js, ensure the 'dark' class is applied to the html or body tag by default.
4. COMPONENT STYLING: When using Shadcn components, override rounded corners to 'rounded-sm' or 'rounded-none'. Use 'border-border' (dark grey) for all borders.
5. LAYOUT: Use the 'Bento Grid' approach. Avoid simple columns. Create dense, data-rich layouts.
6. CHARTS: Use Recharts. Style them with the chart colors defined. Remove grid lines or make them very subtle (#262626).
7. NO EMOJIS: Strictly forbidden. Use Lucide icons for all visual indicators.
8. TONE: All copy must be serious and concise. No 'Welcome back, champion!'. Just 'Training Log'.
9. DATA-TESTID: Add data-testid attributes to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, cards).
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style

Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
